intro: Phyllanthus phialanthoides, commonly known as the silverleaf phyllanthus, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered leaves and yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are often covered in a fine, silvery pubescence, giving it its common name. It is adapted to thrive in well-drained soils and is often found in dry, open habitats.
